values:
its 2am.

i ve sucessfully covered  nearly everything i could with chocolate. 3 trays worth.

i tried to delete my myspace account.

turns out i can't. it is registered with my now defunct and deleted aol account. and u can only send a confirmation via that email. and even if i change the email you gotta activate via the orginal account.

i guess i can;t delete things just like that.

how fucking fitting.

after midnight all the  craiglists housing posts  begin to sound to uppity or hippy.

 I conversely sounds  increasingly sassy and scarcastic :

"Let me know, if you any other questions about me, my references, my credit history, etc all &  those things that proof, why yes I am  responsible."

Please just let me live with you so i don't have to look at another :

house- 1235@ craiglist.com - LOTS OF LIGHTS- 650/mo...  tagline  for a long time


ps. do you know of anyone looking for a roomate in washington dc, ?

so i think the " developer" i work w/ on a daily basis from Karachi faked not feeling well to go out and start partying for the Pakistani day of independence. the aim conversation went something like this :

me : " i am leaving 1.30 hr early. i am not feeling well"
adeel : " sorry to hear that. we can finish these edits tomorrow, no problem"
adeel : " tomorrow we will be non operational because of indepence day"
me : " oh yes that's right. what a inconvenient day to get sick"
adeel : " yes "

oh the ambiguity and complexity of our relationship is outstanding.

it is really hard creating a cross cultural working dynamic via IM and telephone with these guys . it is hard to understand who and what they do . especially since one fella irfan is too shy to talk to me. his english isn;t that good. he is very formal.my boss is pakistan american man. which add another layer ... ohh the power dynamics are bizarrely complicated as well. east , west ,woman, man ,boss, worker . fucked up

for what it is worth i wanted to tell adeel, yeah leave work early. screw work. seriously it prob sucks there as it does here somedays. and it 60 plus yrs of Independence and ur country teeters on collapse w. its crazy political leaders some days so celebrate

you don;t have to lie to me. but i think it really super cute and bad ass that you did.

when did i become a tech geek?
today. when steve jobs & friends blessed us with this

a recipe for midwestern, middle class, professional parental  anxiety  :

1 night of dead-end downtown plans
3-4 whiskeys & blue light 
120mins of hbo on demand therapy
negative phone calls from my BFF, and ....
26 hair curlers
1 late night lil brother & co  booze run
10 more than necessary irish/ hip/hold steady/ post punk rock ex-love/druggie sungs
1-2 intimate conversations about <3,$,& foreign affairs

i've lived here 4 months and tonight i got lost while on running about a block from my place. i've walked these streets countless times. this uber metaphoric.

hmmmmmm

i'm not studying. i am daydreaming hardcore.

i didn't purchase or bring home form buffalo any of three thing i had on my list for this past thanksgiving weekend. though i didn't come back to dc with cotton balls or computer screen cleaner i suppose i did return with a fair amount of perceptive. my parents and brother are quite wonderful. our collective goofiness can still make cry with laughter after a mysterious sound and smell leaves us pointing fingers to the almighty farting culprit. the weather was delightful and i even managed to muster theenergy to trout my out of shape ass around the neighborhood for a few midday runs with my mother. huffing and puffing through the streets where old friends and foes lived, i realize my parents are honestly some of the most opened minded andaccepting people this neighborhood has got. maybe i am biased, because they raised me and all but in neighborhood plagued with such racist and homophobic actions it is interesting to see my parents trying to fight the good fight. they do a pretty good job of calling people out on their shit with being condescending. something, i realize , after a near bawl with a wasted bleached blonde Canada bar babe, i still need some work at. armed with a some great new albums from my brother, an inspiring book from my pappa,and hot eyeliner from my momma i am all set to rock out for the next three weeks in this city. after that, i don't even want to think about howlonely and isolated i anticipate feeling in ithaca (or buffalo) being the friendless and stranded fuck that i really am.

i';ve got  three tales of 13 or so award winners ,"blues clubs dates",and that hairdresser for the carter and clinton administration elite


story one:
an ngo my internship is affiliated introduced to these very lovely kids. attending UN folk  filled ceremonies, traipsing around embassy row district  and attempting to woo yet another Argentine proved a beautiful and happy defeat.
.
http://www.youthactionnet.org/yan_awards/awardwinner.cfm

story two:
every young looking kid in  suit in this city fits the following profile: seond job lawyer from the midwest, rides their bike to work , and has studied/visited in europe. the defenders of justice have very nice mircowaves and woodern floors. i like pretending i am on  top of my game too. apparently certificates and age doesn't matter so much  on the first date. but  come the second time around i  think  they wished i was more impressed by their shelves of legal reference texts and  swimming medals and i wished their jokes were funnier. all and all, we'd make nice neighbors.

http://www.zoobardc.com/,

story three:
since my day to day " job" is  has a net take home of zero, i;ve got a secod job sorting out the business affairs of ms. anne micheals.  today i learned that the curly haired  black poodle she was watching ( named inky) was owned by her long time hairdresser originally from Norway. amidst our organizing receipts and drinking diet cokes, this poodle ran away. we went chasing after it. in a tissy , cenial and half blind, anne saw us ( my roomate greer and i ) on the other side of her street ( trying to cover more ground) and asked if we had seen a black poddle. she didn't know it was us. we said no anne we have not seen inky. she didn't hear us.  she  kept running. inky was found in the bushes in the park next door to  anne. the sun was setting and the national cathedral which dominates the skyscape  was   all lite up.

dear witty district lawyer # 4,000


i lie when i say i work. really i intern. the only think i know of the 92 election is from snl reruns. yes, it sucks that you can't vote. but pelosi did vote on that bill that said you could 5 years ago.things are looking up!

dear very sharply dressed musician



mhmmm. jazz clubs on u street are real nice.it's hard to fool you into anything. cuz you are just keeping it real.

dear second masters in internatioal relations/development
yes, yes. kenya changed your life. the doha talks are reallly making headway. out of darfur or is into to darfur? one can;t tell these days!

dear congressional staffress'



whats your deal? why are there always two of you ? happy hours knock me out too. tweed skirts 4 life!
i have learned so much from the duke ellington bridge.
i am in love with everyone here. periodddddddd.

FYI the staff lounge is not a Dirty Dancing  groove area. P. Swayze may not be in the house, but the World Cup hunks heat up the place pretty nicely. For me , this summer has been all about the power of sport to unite and divide peoples. It is a refreshing change. Yesterday,  I took a nap to Footballer's Wives. Caroline woke me and told me she was addicted to it. 

I did the ole' bait and switch at Hannford's for the best trail mix I have ever had. Fronsy brought candy and Ben brought an  on sale 30 pack of Bud for the BONE YARD. We have a Women's Night and the BONE YARD is the light hearted nickname of the pseudo all male group.  who let the dogs of the  BONEYARD ?

Working is fuckign tiring. Luckily,  I head back to Buffalo in a few days for Uncle Jeff's wedding. It is take a date or pay for the plate time. shhhhhiiiiiitttttt.

it  is the really the simple things that makes these days great:

1. a new  rain jacket from an undisclosed  bargain store...
2.  size 8 rain boots  found in the garden shed
3. warm rhurbarb crisp
4. ginger snaps
5. borrowing great non fiction books ( understanding globalization made easy !) 
6. solo groove party to staff room
7.  new friends with funky names and even funkier laughs : eli,vashiwani,ben,fronzy, caroline, shan and danny


i like it here.

any and all victories require nakedness. thank you overtime play off hockey for bearded dreamboats, half priced canadian beer specials, and cheap firework displays. this solidifies my believe that buffalo can only become unified for change if it involves sports.

i was really into reading this collection of short stories the last few days and after enjoying them so, i decided to read the full introduction. well, i didn't make more then three pages. in light of the irony of this ( i can't get through more then a few pages on central idea at time - in part i blame the re-introduction of tv into my life) i stopped out of frustration when i read this sentence:

" and, as a friend of mine once remarked, reading a long novel is like having a relationship with somebody' it's not just another one stand"

 i took that personal.damn editor is calling me a literary slut. how  intellectually insecure would it be if if switched back to full length fiction?


update- fuck it. i brought a non-fiction book with an amazon gift card.

i'm putting this article here so i can remember to read it when i have time. 
life ain't that cool when you can't read the shit you wanna. 

http://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/23/magazine/23apparel.html?_r=1&oref=slogin

i have fallen in love with devendra banhart and neko case.over and over again.
i have written a pretty rocking albiet rough paper on sucidiegirls.com
i ate a whole bag of chocolate cookies in less then 5 mins.

i reallllllly want it to be may 5th. that's when this ends right ? and i am not spelling checking this . i am dyslexic. deal with it .

i can remember when i was kid and asking annoyingly : what did people do before TV for entertainment? my parents said "books, go read one."

but while listening to business students get into a passive aggressive argument over one member cutting out early on  the "big" project, i found the real answer : easy dropping.  walking around the computer lab or library is like channel surfing. but it's half the price and twice the creep !

the best part of all this is i have the gumption to write this as they sit next to me!

i'm in quite a good mood. i found an internship in dc for next fall that looks just what i was looking. and i didn't even need mr. director of the dc program dr. phone-hone-i-run-this-my-place-on-my-own  to help me. 

working at the info desk on sunday morning isn't terrible as i thought it would be. i just had a really fantastic "fell better" lunch. it was inspired my my neighbor yiery. yesterday after a triple threat of too much to drink, getting sick wihtthe flu and paint fumes ( i wasn't huffing again kids, i was helping out at the FLEEF art installation ) made be barf up meals i had three days ago- yiery brought me soup, bread her mom and grandmother made, raspberries and hot cocca. it was the sweetest thing.

if only this wintery weather would cease.

i have had an un-ethical consumer blowout this week. half of tank of gas and new fucking jeans. i slip into old lazy habits of ignorance when i come to buffalo. my whole being is pushed  to the max in ithaca that when  i come back i go into uber "vacation" mode:  which means  laying around and  over eating. i like catching  with family, neighborhood gossip and  cable tv happenings, but i fear  that  life here leaves me  feeling for the most part unhealthy and lazy rather then energized , relaxed, and  renewed to start back up  ithaca life. is that dictionary definition burn out ?

its spring break. tonight i saw the slip in concert. even though i meet with eddy and some of his fredonia friends ( here's the scence - hey you look familar - oh the ex - of one of my college friends - but we have nothing to say to each other smile, sip drink, look at band ..) it was definitely a solo mission. really wonderful. mi amor nuevo /lead singer - he looks my old film prof minus a few kilos of coke i could have stayed for 15 more minutes of gawking at good looking musicians and tagged along for an after party but for some reason i wasn't feeling it. as it turns out i spent the remainder of the night learning about booze,dicks,seminary high school, chicago nightlife and pains of story story writing from my brother's house guest marty fucking mcfly. he looks .. the power on this laptop is dying. so i'm off. night comrades
tonight i've got more to do then i can fathom. and i can't seem to buckle down and just do it . my mindset is scatttered and half hearted. all i want to do is watch this again :

i can't focus in the library right now because the gentleman next to me looks very simlair to Kevin McDonald from the ferciously funny Kids in the Hall. oh dear, my academic excellence , just another thing ruined by Canadians.

... it is because when you are trugging across campus you feel like a foot solider out in the brush. because your apartment is now  sooooo far away from  central campus - or at least  it feel that ways, one must pack all their daily belongings on their back . so i now carry two backpacks full of things i could possibly need during the day's march. including Tupperware,to snake food from the mess halls. and the end of the day you kick off your boots that are  all muddy from shortcut you thought was real smart at the time and curse to the heavens for trenchfoot. in other news, i am tossing around theme ideas for the upcoming shindig - after this entry i feel like an armed forces theme bash could be interesting but typical. The first annual Shell Shock or Post Traumatic Stress Disorder for the PC crowd.  then again my original idea is still  quite clever : Homemakers and Homewreckers . i like it because it sounds like a feminist manifesto now all it needs is snappy subtitle...

I have Jane Jetson  fingers from transferring so many calls all across this god damn campus and pressing my Ipod every few seconds when their annoyance interprets and takes precedence over my musical jubilation. Ten hours every day for a week of this  and its' not half bad. Contrary to popular belief, Ithaca is really fucking neato when the majority of people aren't around and one does not have anything to accomplish. 


There is a beautiful sunset.Too bad you are missing it. Shit, and  President Williams and I just discussed it. We shared a moment. Now, if she would only shared her money to improve  beloved academia.


Now I am listening to  el Talking Heads.
Which is tops the prior two.

no particular reason for posting. i haven't done this in months. i am on my 6th movie of the day. i joined myspace for the hell of it.  i am going to philly in a few days.  and i might not sleep on the couch today for the first time since i have been home.  it is not even January and i got stressed about summer plans tonight. i went for a walk tonight to clear my hear and i ended up walking by the bar across from the golf course  whose name escapes me. tommy sullivan  worked there. but the owner is fixing it up  to re open and he was all by himself with a pitcher of beer, a broom, a hammer and the hockey game on. he waved and i laughed because it was south buffalo in a nutshell . lastly , i got asked this question: if you could rename one thing that people use on a daily basis what would it be and why.

back when i used AOL e-mail , i could have sworn there was an un-send button if the recipient didn't read the e-mail yet. ithaca webmail has no such unsend button. i looked half heartedly. 

so there is no unsend, even if all you want to change about your words is spelling and grammar.


sidenote, all these pets are lovely but me and kat could never do it. i would definitely forget they existed in my room and kat would sent them free. but i am glad they bring you all  joy and  they make holmes very homey.

i love the naked science club, especially solo sunrise missions.

oh man, somehow i found my way to this website this afternoon... 
http://www.whitehouse.gov/kids/ofelia/index.html

"I love to spend time dreaming, and like my owner, I hope you will dare to dream big dreams. There are many Americans who dreamed big dreams"

god bless our nation's loghorns who inspire us all.

so i am in the office tonight.all night long these 3 or 4 seven year old boys keep bumming around the office window asking when  9 o'clock is because is when they are allowed to work the the coveted snack bar. so they are strolling in poking around and you know askign a thousand and one questions about everything from my birth weight to how scotch tape was invented. now, i love an iqustive kid don't get me wrong. and the more questions  the better for the devlopment and growth- but come on i got a very important job to do and do well- i am making photocopies of the  maps 20 surrounding hiking trails. this is essentinal to the peace and justice movement - i shalt be lured off the path.  so keep their pesky paws of  the copy machine. i slowly begin to fabriricate quite the intricate tale about  the last 7 year old who had his way with the copy machine

" oh ya? what happened?"
"  nobody really know for sure."
" really what can a copy machine do anybody?"
" that's  exactly what she thought"
" tell us-  we seen nightmare before christmas!"
" i can't really talk about- i mean i signed a FBI report saying i wouldn't"

" it has kinda a humming sound- like musice"
" ya one that lulls you to sleep really . makes eveything sorta of a rhythmical you get into a rountine. you slowly become drowsy. so you don't even know what you are doing."

" look at how that light goes back and forth - it could blind you its so bright!"
" i imagine thats what happened first. she opened the top to replace a copy and suddenly this intense bright light beamed forth like a sunrise she couldn't see in front of her hands. all she saw in her head was darkness. darker than she had ever know."

" and whats that bin?"
" thats where the papers is supposed to go in. its allways that white and clean, excpect that one time of course"


etc.etc....

needless to say 20 mins later a got a good number  of adults and staff memebers in on. and i know i am evil but i hope they lay awake tonight imagining what happened to that fateful 7 year old.

really, i am just encouraging creative thinking..

muhawwwwww


ps. i just held a baby for the first time in 5 years two seconds ago and i am in love with it. ohhh god my job is awesome holding babies,scarying kids, calling crushes, and writing stories

its crazy what you can convience yourself is real.
i was swimming back from blueberry island yesterday afternoon, and each time i saw a large shallow rock undernearth the water my mind was dead set on believing it was a maintee. i have even seen a real maintee in the wild in miami 5 years ago or so, and they don't look anything like whitton pond rocks but still i would get myself really freaked out, my heart would start pounding and my body freeze up and i would have to stop for a second .i would swam ten strokes in the opposite direction and repeat outloud that there are no maintees in new hampshire. 
its been a really sad week.

hold apt object in hand and proclaim...

"FORKgive me I have fallen in love with you"
"Oh, it's  just too SPOON, maybe LADDLE"
"But PITCHER us together"
" I know, it's been KNIFE getting to know you"
" I could WHISK you away from this place"

any additions  to our little love word game?

oh yes ,does anyone know kalia's summer ithaca address?

i had the best meal of my life. i think it was because it just fit perfectly with the atmostsphere. it was the perfect meal for that very moment.  fore going many details i will say that it was a sweaty summer evening which included beets and a ripen cool plum.

oh and we also all wore crazy hats at dinner. god knows i loves me a hat party!

the only thing i don't like about the books i am reading is that i can't leave my risque titled literature lying about the place for the little childern to stumble upon.  they both have such beautiful covers to hold in your hands so i adore walking around the lodge with them. but sadly
i don't have the intelligence or the engery to explain to an  inquistive five year old that this book is helping  me reclaim the word cunt (inga muscio) and (the) abortion is a hysterical love story " about the romantic possibilties  in 1960's california library" rRichard brautigan)and not scary big words we shouldn't yell in crowds.


7,000 macedonian warriors poised and ready in full battle arrray
9 sympathtic diabetic old men with canes

the days have been getting much better.  good time had and much to look forward to. possible raft sleepover sunset watching tonight, another installment of " the night before" puppet show, spanish lessons , a birthday surprize, and of course there is always 3 meals a day and garden dirt. plenty of garden dirt. i walked back from the weller garden this afternoon with a stirrup hoe over my shoulder kicking  pieces of gravel up the road covered in said dirt.  how beauiful it is to be a coutry bumpkin.

we've got a phatom lurking in our bunk. " it" leaves us candy, ballons and magic marker messages! 

dave the worldest most fablous head cook left today. his goodbye was just a perfect one. short and not arkward. no false promises. hey im leaving now actucally. been great meeting you . and drop me an email. hug and a classy euro style kiss.

i have had alot of goodbyes in the past six months and i  remeber ever damn one. i am looking forward to getting back to ithaca land so i can say some hey how the fuck the are you for a change.


 is it offically mid summer ?

so forton willard came to visit us. we'll not me really. he just knew my name. he came for miko. the first time he wanted to take her to maine the next day. she attempted to decline ever so politley. he returned the next day with his manuscript. he is no longer welcome at world fellowship.

i  just read a headline that said that skateboarder cleared the great wall of china. is that true ?

i have been looking alot of pictures lately. both online and other peoples here.  i miss europe alot alot and ithaca even more. 



 tommrow is sunday which means turkey dinner here. which means another turkey burial next to the compost pile. maybe this time after some  poetic last words  and scopes of dirt and dry leaves our beloved little fowl will not be grave robbed and its remains scattered nearby as in last week's horrible occurence. at least lil t, or terrace has momma bird called him, provided nutiturion to some other living organism. we love the circle of life don't get me wrong , but we are just jaded that we didn't get to see the bear that feasted on our little friend.

Last night, we all piled into a beat up but brute of stationwagon and drove to the next town over to go contra dancing. What is contra dancing you ask ? Well,  according to Les Francey and Farrell Boyce, Contra Dancing is a form of American folk dance in which the dancers form a set of two parallel lines which run the length of the hall. Each dance consists of a sequence of moves that ends with couples having progressed one position up or down the set. As the sequence is repeated, a couple will eventually dance with every other couple in the set. Contra Dancing was all the rage in 1800.

Let me tell you there are some serious hardcore contra dancers out there that you don't want to mess. We all got some sneers and cold stares from the over over eighty crowd.I also meet a man who donned an Phantom of the Operasque  outfit with three gold rings as his daily attire. He went by Forton Willard.

Getting back to the WFC from the barn in the pouring rain with non functioning windsheild wipers and no fuel was another adventure. We would have fared better if we just took the horse and buggy.

Ye hawhhhhahhaha for New England.

does anyone have one of these fancy anti carpal tonal keyboard, ya know the ones that have a huge fault line of space down the center?  my hands are working twice as hard to type properly. burn it if you do.

i have an uncanny ability to seek and then live for extended periods time in the most bizzare places on this planet. the ones that are un touched by the outside world.

the is no rhyme or reason to the organization to the video collectin on our staff room. the carebears movie is next to vertigo and nukes in space the pbs mini seris is  next to ghostdog. yes, they have ghostdog.

come visit. we can row boats to the islands on the lake and climb this mountation  ... http://www.nescenicphoto.com/newhamshire/images/nh_mtchocorva_lg.jpg


the staff is small but pretty rad. more people arrive today . hopefully the directors wouldn't forgot to pick them up at the bus station like they did me at 10pm on wednesday. me and a few other of the other girls will most likely end up dashing off  during  tonight 's wedding rehersal dinner and picking them up in a station wagon with bullet holes in the windsheilds. 

ithaca webmail does not work yet again. i burnt  the roof of my mouth on oatmeal this morning. the head cook fixes organs  for a living and listens to chamber music  all day long in the kitchen . the french couple on the staff watched grease last night. i looked at mieko's polariad's of her going away party.

doing alright. doing alright, just alright...

1. http://photos13.flickr.com/20064861_27d9dcac7c_b.jpg

 this one is for you my darling c-bear.

everyone one of my friends in brno heard me talk about taking this picture  for the entire time went spent in the czech. each time we went to the tesco or the interspar (the supermarkets of the city) i would say something how i really needed to get around to taking that picture. not only did it take me 4 months to finnally get someone with a working digital camera ( thanks to sir per from norway ) but also it took me just as long  to figure out what the little shop was. despite frequent stops in and looking up in my dictionary some of words on the signs, i didn't have a clue what this place sold or the service it provided.when it was wedged between jewelery shop and gift wrapping place in the middle of 3 store supermarkert. it could be any number of things. i would sneak in and investigae what kind of opearatation they were running in there every so often. but, i swear the czech kept their bussiness' under tight wraps. my theory was it was a travel agency. but of of course that was its cover !like most post commy bussiness' it had that cold and  nothing but the facts type feel to it. coustumer service  doesn;t exist. you want something we've got so you start talking and maybe wil give it to you. i always felt liek a waiting for my month's ration of toliet paper and eggs at some of these place. long q's and no one talking. strictly busssiness. i could wander into the room for a few mintutes and usually there was no one behind the counter and if some would turn up i would just say the traditional good day greeting and continue  to look around. they just  went back to  talking to themselves  and looking out into space coldy as usual as i went about figuring out what the place was.  i did this for so many stores/ or supposed bussiness establishments during my time there. i still believe most  bussiness  places are just fronts for some fishy activity. 

.. turns out it was a dry cleaning service. i saw a van with the same name while riding  on the tram one morning.because no obligations as per usual, i  jumped off followed it to the old german officer district and watched a guy unload hangers full of dresses and tuxs. bugger. maybe they hid coke or crystall meth in  the front pockets of the suit coats for thier clients. i can dream can't i ?

2.http://photos17.flickr.com/20064860_d29b8a8080.jpg

this was our day trip to the best town in all of moravia.( the area of the czech republic i lived  in - the other one is one you all have heard of,  bohemia and its capital is prague , naturally. not too much difference besides folk tradtions.. okay ya thats huge difference and beer, very different beer )  olomouc. we snuck into some university classrooms that were built in 4th century. or close  enough. we pratically wrote out our names in our sweat on that blackboards in was so hot. the bottle pavel aka tim is holding was the first of about 10 peach and pear cappy drins we each consumed on that day. i spent nearly 10 dollars in drinks just that day. and thats a lot of money just fro drinks.
 im making fun of tim's delightful spanish roomate  daniel with my strange pose. daniel was dressed up all snazzy and his hair was all shiny and greasy the night before as we were making dinner so we asked him if he had a date, and because daniel speaks no english we played sharade games with him for about 10 mins only figure out in fact he was going to church and not taking a shower despite the confusing action he kept repeating to resemeble a church steple and not a shower head.

oh good times...

now i should be setting up tables or scooping melons into tiny balls for the big ole party now. but i'm a bad ass and broke into the doritos and decided to get away for a while..

i brought two new notebooks at the dollar store. rather my mother brought them. i thought it apt to start a technological savvy journal as well. one minney and mickey mouse, one floppy purple one, and one html hypertextilized one. okay, just a trendy live journal. hey, i want to be one of the cool kids,too.
